calc package¶

Submodules¶

calc.node module¶

Implements nested directed graphs. Like folders, they organize DFT computations.

class calc.node.Node(name, prev, parent, x=None, y=None)¶

Implements a generic “node” in a nested directed graph.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Node’s name. ‘/’ will be silently replaced with ‘|’, to facilitate id.
  • prev (Node) – Previous node, can be None.
  • parent (Node) – Parent node, is None for root node
  • x (float) – x coordinate. None to use random number
  • y (float) – y coordinate. None to use random number
id¶

Slash-join of all ancestors’ names.

Joins the node’s name, its parent’s name, it’s grandparent’s name, all the way to but excluding “root”, by slash(/). It’s the node’s UID in a nested graph.

Caveat: While a Unix filesystem look-and-feel is achieved, the root node’s id is qualitatively different, which may cause problems.

Returns:UID of the node, e.g. “/PbS QD/bare qd/o(e) performance”
Return type:str
name = None¶

str: Node’s name.

parent = None¶

weakref.ProxyType to parent Node, or None for root node.

prev = None¶

weakref.ProxyType to prev Node, or None. Similar to a double linked list, the pointer needs to be updated when the node is moved

x = None¶

float in (-100, 100). x coordinate when drawn in 2D by Ogma.js

y = None¶

float in (-100, 100). y coordinate

calc.node.id(id)¶

The node identified by id.

(Consider) the node whose id is id. Located by iterating through each segment of id.

Parameters:id (Node.id) – the query
Returns:the response to query
Return type:Node
Raises:KeyError – if the node identified by id does not exist

calc.util module¶

Implement constants and utility functions.

calc.util.slugify(value)¶

Turns a string into a valid filename.

Normalizes string, converts to lowercase, removes non-alpha characters, and converts spaces to hyphens.

Taken from django/utils/text.py. In Django, a “slug” is a URL- and filename- friendly string.

Parameters:value (unicode) – String to be converted
Returns:Filename-friendly string
Return type:unicode
Raises:TypeError – if value is not unicode string

Module contents¶

Implements and automates quantum-chemical calculations.
